intro: Banisteria ternata, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Banisteria ternata is often grown as an ornamental plant for its showy appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
